alert.note: Alert for Albemarle; Augusta; City of Harrisonburg; City of Staunton; City of Waynesboro; Greene; Nelson; Page; Rockingham; Shenandoah (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 6:29PM EDT until July 28 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Nelson County in central Virginia... Southwestern Shenandoah County in northwestern Virginia... Southeastern Rockingham County in western Virginia... Southwestern Page County in northwestern Virginia... Western Albemarle County in central Virginia... Western Greene County in central Virginia... Eastern Augusta County in western Virginia... The City of Staunton in western Virginia... The City of Harrisonburg in western Virginia... The City of Waynesboro in western Virginia... * Until 745 PM EDT. * At 628 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles east of Brandywine to near Glasgow, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Harrisonburg, Staunton, Waynesboro, Stuarts Draft, Bridgewater, Crozet, Broadway, Grottoes, Timberville, Shenandoah, Massanutten, Crimora, Stanley, Sherando, Shipman, Schuyler, Free Union, Wintergreen, Afton and Dale Enterprise. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

area.areaDesc: Albemarle; Augusta; City of Harrisonburg; City of Staunton; City of Waynesboro; Greene; Nelson; Page; Rockingham; Shenandoah
